def_cn: 以下义项中未列的表达方式请参见第13项。
def_en: ⇒ Please look at category 13 to see if the expression you are looking for is shown under another headword.

def_cn: (用于表示想要开口说话)嗯，唔
def_en: You say well to indicate that you are about to say something.

def_cn: (用于表示想要继续话题)这个，不过
def_en: You say well to indicate that you intend or want to carry on speaking.

def_cn: (用于转换话题)对了，好了
def_en: You say well to indicate that you are changing the topic, and are either going back to something that was being discussed earlier or are going on to something new.

def_cn: (用于表示谈话结束)好吧，好了
def_en: You say well to indicate that you have reached the end of a conversation.

def_cn: (用于委婉地提出建议、批评、更正等)那么，嗯
def_en: You say well to make a suggestion, criticism, or correction seem less definite or rude.

def_cn: (用于停顿之前或之后，尤为给自己留出思考的时间)嗯，唔
def_en: You say well just before or after you pause, especially to give yourself time to think about what you are going to say.

def_cn: (用于更正刚说过的话)噢
def_en: You say well when you are correcting something that you have just said.

def_cn: (用于对他人所说的话表示怀疑)哦
def_en: You say well to express your doubt about something that someone has said.

def_cn: (用于表示惊讶或气愤)啊，哟，好啦
def_en: You say well to express your surprise or anger at something that someone has just said or done.

def_cn: (用于等待他人回应，常表示不耐烦)嗯，那么，接着呢
def_en: You say well to indicate that you are waiting for someone to say something and often to express your irritation with them.

def_cn: (用于表示被听到或见到的所逗乐并常引出评论)哟，好啦
def_en: You use well to indicate that you are amused by something you have heard or seen, and often to introduce a comment on it.

def_cn: (用于表示勉强接受)算了
def_en: You say oh well to indicate that you accept a situation or that someone else should accept it, even though you or they are not very happy about it, because it is not too bad and cannot be changed.
very well→see: very;

def_cn: (以标准或程度来说)好，出色地
def_en: If you do something well, you do it to a high standard or to a great extent.

def_cn: 完全地;彻底地
def_en: If you do something well, you do it thoroughly and completely.

def_cn: (评价)高，令人满意地
def_en: If you speak or think well of someone, you say or think favourable things about them.

def_cn: (用于过去分词前表示达到很高标准或极大程度)
def_en: Well is used in front of past participles to indicate that something is done to a high standard or to a great extent.

def_cn: (标准或程度)多少，怎样
def_en: You use well to ask or talk about the extent or standard of something.

def_cn: (用于介词短语前表示强调)大大地，远远地
def_en: You use well in front of a prepositional phrase to emphasize it. For example, if you say that one thing happened well before another, you mean that it happened a long time before it.

def_cn: (用于某些形容词前表示强调)很，相当
def_en: You use well before certain adjectives to emphasize them.

def_cn: (置于描述情感的形容词前表示强调)非常
def_en: Some people use well before adjectives referring to feelings to emphasize that the feeling is very strong.

def_cn: (用于 perfectly，jolly，damn 等副词后，强调观点或真相)
def_en: You use well after adverbs such as 'perfectly', 'jolly', or 'damn' in order to emphasize an opinion or the truth of what you are saying.

def_cn: (用于may，could等动词后，表示可能发生)有理由地，很可能地
def_en: You use well after verbs such as 'may' and 'could' when you are saying what you think is likely to happen.

def_cn: 也;还
def_en: You use as well when mentioning something which happens in the same way as something else already mentioned, or which should be considered at the same time as that thing.

def_cn: 除…之外;也;还
def_en: You use as well as when you want to mention another item connected with the subject you are discussing.

def_cn: 情理之中地;毫不奇怪地
def_en: If you say, after stating that something has happened or is the case, as well it might or as well it may, you mean that this is not at all surprising or is quite appropriate.

def_cn: 幸亏
def_en: If you say that something that has happened is just as well, you mean that it is fortunate that it happened in the way it did.

def_cn: (用于建议某一特定思路或行动)最好（做…）
def_en: You say it is as well to think or do something when you are advising someone to think in a particular way or to take a particular action.

def_cn: （用于建议或推荐）应该（去做…）
def_en: If you say that someone would do well to do something, you mean that you advise or recommend that they do it.

def_cn: (几乎)和…一样
def_en: If you say that something, usually something bad, might as well be true or may as well be true, you mean that the situation is the same or almost the same as if it were true.

def_cn: 只好(做);(做…)也无妨
def_en: If you say that you might as well do something, or that you may as well do it, you mean that you will do it although you do not have a strong desire to do it and may even feel slightly unwilling to do it.

def_cn: 尽可如此
def_en: If you say that something is all well and good, you are suggesting that it has faults or disadvantages, although it may appear to be correct or reasonable.

def_cn: 固然很好；也好
def_en: You say well and good or all well and good to indicate that you would be pleased if something happens but you are aware that it has some disadvantages.

def_cn: 幸而摆脱了；幸而不受牵连
def_en: If you say to someone who is no longer involved in a situation that they are well out of it, you mean that it is a good thing they are no longer involved and they should be pleased about this.

def_cn: 完全;彻底
def_en: If you say that something is well and truly finished, gone, or done, you are emphasizing that it is completely finished or gone, or thoroughly done.

def_cn: 还不错;还好
def_en: If you say that you like something or someone well enough, you mean that you quite like them or find them reasonably acceptable.
all very well→see: all;  to know full well→see: full;  to leave well alone→see: leave;  to mean well→see: mean;  pretty well→see: pretty;

def_cn: 身体健康的;安康的
def_en: If you are well, you are healthy and not ill.

def_cn: 井;水井
def_en: A well is a hole in the ground from which a supply of water is extracted.

def_cn: 油井
def_en: A well is an oil well.

def_cn: 涌出;冒出;流出;溢出
def_en: If liquids, for example tears, well, they come to the surface and form a pool.

def_cn: (某种情感)迸发，涌起
def_en: If an emotion wells in you, it suddenly becomes stronger, to the point where you have to express it.
